author: Lucy Craymer
title: Stocks Slide as China-U.S. Trade Conflict Kicks Off
text:
U.S. stocks head for steep weekly losses Facebook on course for worst week in years Shares in Hong Kong, Australia, Shanghai close lower U.S. stocks slipped Friday and headed for their worst week since the height of February’s stock rout, after a rocky stretch of trading amplified investors’ concerns about a possible trade war. 
The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 99 points, or 0.4%, to 23857, wiping out its gains from earlier in the session. The S&P 500 fell 0.6% and the Nasdaq Composite shed 0.9%.
